conclusion: Determine the distance s between two adjacent bullets in the air.
Cart A is moving to the left with speed v1.
Cart B is moving to the right with speed v2.
The gun on Cart A fires bullets with a speed v0 relative to the ground.
Bullets are fired every Δt0 seconds.
The speed of the bullet relative to Cart A is v0 + v1.
The speed of the bullet relative to Cart B is v0 - v2.
Each bullet hits the target when the next bullet is fired.
The time taken for a bullet to travel from Cart A to Cart B is Δt0.
During the time Δt0, the first bullet travels a distance v0 Δt0 relative to the ground.
The second bullet is fired at the end of Δt0 and starts traveling the same path.
The distance s between two consecutive bullets in the air is the distance the first bullet travels during the time Δt0.
The distance s between two adjacent bullets is s = v0 Δt0.
The distance between two adjacent bullets in the air is s = v0 Δt0.
Assumes bullets maintain a constant speed v0 relative to the ground and firing does not affect the speeds of the carts.
